headline: BD Announces $110 Million to Support U.S. Pharmaceutical Supply Chain for Biologic Drugs
summary: BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company) (NYSE: BDX), a leading global medical technology company, today announced a $110 million investment to expand its production of prefillable syringes, helping accelerate biologic and GLP-1 drug delivery and supporting pharmaceutical reshoring in the U.S. This investment will bring BD Neopak™ Glass Prefillable Syringe production to Columbus, Nebraska, creating approximately 120 new jobs and reinforcing the company's supply resilience within its Pharmaceutical Sys

content.title: BD Announces $110 Million to Support U.S. Pharmaceutical Supply Chain for Biologic Drugs
content.summary: BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company) (NYSE: BDX), a leading global medical technology company, today announced a $110 million investment to expand its production of prefillable syringes, helping accelerate biologic and GLP-1 drug delivery and supporting pharmaceutical reshoring in the U.S. This investment will bring BD Neopak™ Glass Prefillable Syringe production to Columbus, Nebraska, creating approximately 120 new jobs and reinforcing the company's supply resilience within its Pharmaceutical Sys

thumbnail.caption: BD is investing $100 million to establish BD Neopak™ Glass Prefillable Syringe production at its Columbus, Nebraska site.
